title: Watch: Sign On Pakistan's Train Says 'Karachi To Los Angeles' & People Can't Stop Laughing!
text:
Watch: Sign On Pakistan's Train Says 'Karachi To Los Angeles' & People Can't Stop Laughing!

Watch: Sign On Pakistan's Train Says 'Karachi To Los Angeles' & People Can't Stop Laughing!

If you want to experience how it is to travel to Los Angeles in a train, then this train which runs from Pakistan’s Karachi will give you that experience. Well, at least that is what the sign board on it, says.

Who says Pakistan Railways has not reached new heights under Sheikh Rashid? pic.twitter.com/4nrPGsjzkh — Hasan Zaidi (@hyzaidi) October 6, 2019

The video shows a signboard on a Pakistan Railways' train at Sukkur’s Rohri station, reading Karachi to Los Angeles, which has left social media users in fits of laughter. People are taking a jab at the service with many witty comments.

Twitter became an open ground for memes after the viral video of, what can only be assumed as a mistake on the part of Pakistan Railways, garnered attention on social media.

Pakistanis are really very entertaining and funny people on earth..😂😂 — sheshpal choudhary (@sheshpalchoudh1) October 6, 2019 2.

Hahaha now this is funny — hira (@HiraGuddy) October 6, 2019 3.

London kehtay tuu theoretically possible hota...US is not even possible on map 😀 — Kamran Arshad (@kamranarshad) October 6, 2019 5.

Wait till it reaches Mars... — Khalid Lakhani (@KhalidLakhani) October 6, 2019 6.

Rohri in California??? — Muhammad Yamin (@myamin325) October 6, 2019 7.

The video garnered 24.9 k views and 615 likes.

Responding to the entire gaffe, Pakistan’s Railway Minister Sheikh Rashid Ahmed said, “If Allah wills, his Ministry would run a train to Los Angeles.” He further said that the incident was perhaps a prank by one of the passengers.

Recently, the Railway Minister was in the news when he got an electric shock while he was talking about Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
description: If you want to experience how it is to travel to Los Angeles in a train, then this train which runs from Pakistan’s Karachi will give you that experience! No kidding! If you don’t believe me, then watch this video: Twitter became an open ground for memes after a viral video of a sign malfunction by Pakistan Railways garnered attention on social media.
